ratings.comment: Professor Kelley knows her material, but she is extremely bad at conveying this to the class, and DOES NOT KNOW how to explain concepts very well. In addition, she is rather absent minded, but on the bright side, very enthusiastic and willing to help. The course itself is very misleading, and stretches the material in order to fill up the semester.

Class was not at all what I expected. Course guide said it was British and American Writers, but he called it life forms. You read all scientific literature. She discusses content in lecture, but expects you to know figurative language for the final. Horrible class. I regret taking it. Save yourself and your GPA and opt out of this class.

Class is not what it sounds like in the description. The class was easy, but extremely boring. Multiple long articles to read each week. No tests or quizzes and papers are very easy to do. If you have the ability to make stuff up as you go, you'll be fine. Attendance in discussion is mandatory, lecture is randomized

The professor is very enthusiastic about her work, but overall, a terrible class. Material is very poorly explained and the course description is very misleading. Was excited to take this class until we actually got into the material. If you have to take this class, prepare to be confused. Also, attendance is randomized. Beware.

Took this class thinking it was about British and American literature.  I was wrong.  It was all scientific essays from the 18th and 19th century.  She is very unclear with her assignments, and although passionate about what she does, the format of the class does not make sense.  I regret taking this course. It's not hard, but it's not for me.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! YOU WILL REGRET IT.

The lectures are pretty boring, but the class as a whole is reasonably easy. The only test is the final, which can be difficult, but it wasn't impossible. I thought she was an interesting person, with a lot of intelligent insight. I sometimes got too complicated to pay attention but overall an alright class.

Kelley is like Mrs. Hafer from Drake & Josh; ie the quintessentially bad English professor. Her lectures are painfully boring and there is a lot of pointless reading. The TAs do all the grading and there are only three essays, so in that respect it's pretty easy. Be sure to follow the syllabus and attend class.

Discussion of Romantic poetry is passionate and engaging. No tests, just two papers and a smaller assignment. Attendance is MANDATORY; the lecture is about 25 people, and she expects participation every day. If you do the readings and make the effort to contribute, you will be rewarded. If you don't try, don't expect a good grade in this class.
She cares way too much about the material and expects you to love it as well. And she hates it when you disagree with her, so don't, because she plays favorites.

Her class will try your emotions like no other.  I wrote a 59 page paper (including metadata)for 90% of my grade, and I had to read thousands (no lie) of pages of boring crap for the other 10%. Don't get me wrong, Kelley is very nice and an easy grader, but the class will devour your free time.

She read off her lecture notes the ENTIRE time. Acted really irritable in class and was often late. Most boring class ever; actively painful to attend. The material was easy if you went to discussion; you didn't even have to read it. If you are considering being an English major or just want to take an enjoyable literature class, don't take this on
I thought she was very sweet and caring.  What she had to say I found intellectual and insightful. Obviously loves english and wants to share her love with her class.

I felt that she talked for the sole purpose of hearing herself talk.  She did not prepare meaningful lectures, most of what she was discussing no one was able to follow.  She did very little with the material f/ novels. Her TAs did everything for her (teaching the important stuff & grading) & her final was not based on what we discussed in class.

It was one of the worst classes I have ever attended.  The final was completely unreasonable and did not give you nearly enough time to complete it successfully.  The lectures were extremely painful to attend because they were so boring since she just read from a sheet of paper and talked in such an annoying voice.

Personally I think she is absolutely horrible.  Her lectures are pretty much her reading off of a sheet and you writing down what she says.  The TA's grade all the papers and her final is pretty much every tiny thing she mentioned in class.

english is not my favorite area, and she definitely did not change that. Very neutral Professor, not abrasive or anything. Subject matter terrible especially if you dont like literature to begin with, aside from the reading of Frankenstein i hated this class. and the TAs rate your paper.

Professor Kelley's lectures are scattered and dull. Her analysis of the poetry and novels barely scrape the surface of meaning. The class is not particularly difficult, but it's also not particularly interesting.

Very good class. She is engaging, and will absolutely engage students who care to put in time. Not difficult if you are intelligent and capable, and she teaches English how it should be taught, concerned with the pursuit of truly getting something from the literature.
